description: '''J-core''' is the style of [[hardcore techno]] associated with [[Music of Japan|Japanese]] groups and [[Disc jockey|DJs]] from the 1990s onward. Originally called "Japcore", the name "J-core" is an abbreviation of "'''Japanese hardcore'''". It is marked by its usage of samples derived from [[video game]]s and [[anime]], colorful [[kawaii]] imagery and album graphics, and the general borrowing of elements from [[otaku]] culture. J-core music is often found in [[Rhythm game|rhythm games]] and forms a substantial part of the [[doujin music]] scene.
